tit.cmt: 通りの名前であったようですので、Machi-koji Street とタイトルを変更しました。

sen.j: 町小路（まちこうじ）とは、中世日本京都の町衆の中心となった通りであり、そこには土倉が建ち並んでいた。
sen.e: Machikoji were streets lined with Tsuchikura that were central to the townspeople of Kyoto in the middle ages.
Machikoji were streets lined with Tsuchikura that were central to the townspeople of Kyoto in the middle ages.
Machi-koji Street was a street that was central to the townspeople of Kyoto in the middle ages, and was lined with doso (underground warehouses).
sen.cmt: 土倉→doso (underground warehouses) としました。

sen.j: 町小路の前身は、平安京の町尻小路であり、江戸時代以降は、新町通となる。
sen.e: The predecessor of machikoji were the Machijirikoji of Heiankyo and these became Shimachidori from the Edo period.
The predecessor of machikoji were the Machijirikoji of Heiankyo and these became Shimachidori from the Edo period.
The predecessor of machikoji were the Machijiri-koji Street of Heian-kyo and became Shinmachi-dori Street from the Edo period.
sen.cmt: Machijiri-koji Street, Shinmachi-dori Street としました。

sen.j: 地勢的には、鴨川 (淀川水系)が氾濫しても、その影響の及ばない高台に属し、当時の京都の一等地である。
sen.e: Geologically, they were first-rate locations in Kyoto at that time because they were on high grounds that would not be affected by the flooding of the Kamo River (Yodo river system).
Geologically, they were first-rate locations in Kyoto at that time because they were on high grounds that would not be affected by the flooding of the Kamo River (Yodo river system).
Geologically, it was a first-rate location in Kyoto at that time because it was on high grounds that would not be affected by the flooding of the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system).
sen.cmt: they→ it、Kamo River → Kamo-gawa River としました。

sen.j: そして、そこ並んでいたのは、商人の商家や職人の工房であり、それに対し、公家や武家は、より洪水の危険の及ぶ東洞院通以東に居を構えていた。
sen.e: The merchant houses and factories of the craftspeople lined the streets, whereas the courtiers and military families had homes east of the Todoin dori, which was more prone to flooding.
The merchant houses and factories of the craftspeople lined the streets, whereas the courtiers and military families had homes east of the Todoin dori, which was more prone to flooding.
The merchant houses and factories of the craftspeople lined the street, whereas the courtiers and military families had homes east of the Higashinotoin-dori Street, which was more prone to flooding.
sen.cmt: 東洞院通→Higashinotoin-dori Street と変更しました。

sen.j: 町衆の中の富裕層は、「有徳人」と称され、祇園会の際に国家に代わって山鉾巡行の費用を拠出し、「潤屋の賤民」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: The wealthier townspeople were called "Utokujin" and paid for the Yamahoko Junko (procession of Gion Festival Floats) during the Gion Kai instead of the government and were called "Junya no Senmin".
The wealthier townspeople were called "Utokujin" and paid for the Yamahoko Junko (procession of Gion Festival Floats) during the Gion Kai instead of the government and were called "Junya no Senmin".

The wealthier townspeople were called 'Utokunin' and paid for the Yamahoko Junko (procession of Gion Festival Floats) during the Gion-e (service for souls of Gion) instead of the government and were called 'Junya no Senmin' (people of the lower class who are wealthy).
sen.cmt: 潤屋の賤民→people of the lower classe who are wealthy と補足しました（定訳不明です）。

sen.j: 平安京以来、現在も用いられる「東西通＋南北通」（例：四条烏丸）という地点の表記の方法にならい、町小路が東西の通りと交差する地点は、「○○＋町」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Following the notation method of "East-West street and North-South street" (example: Shijo Karasuma) used even today that began with the establishment of Heiankyo, the location where a machikoji bisects a East-West street was called "?? cho".

Following the notation method of "East-West street and North-South street" (example: Shijo Karasuma) used even today that began with the establishment of Heiankyo, the location where a machikoji bisects a East-West street was called "?? cho".

Following the notation method of 'East-West street and South-North street' (example: Shijo Karasuma) used even today that began with the establishment of Heian-kyo, the location where a Machi-koji Street bisects a East-West street was called 'XX-cho (town).'
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を補足しました。

sen.e: Nijo cho
Nijo cho
Nijo-cho:
sen.cmt: ハイフン、コロンを追加しました。

sen.j: - 米商人が多く、1330年、後醍醐天皇が安価に米を拠出させた。
sen.e: Many rice merchants lived here and in 1330, Emperor Godaigo had them sell rice at a discounted price.
Many rice merchants lived here and in 1330, Emperor Godaigo had them sell rice at a discounted price.
Many rice merchants lived here and in 1330, Emperor Godaigo had them sell rice at a discounted price.
Sanjyo cho
Sanjyo cho
Sanjo-cho
sen.cmt: ハイフンを追加しました。

sen.e: Rokaku cho
Rokaku cho
Rokkaku-cho
sen.cmt: ハイフンを追加しました。

sen.e: Nishikikoji cho
Nishikikoji cho
Nishikikoji-cho
sen.cmt: ハイフンを追加しました。

sen.e: Shijyo cho
Shijyo cho
Shijo-cho:
sen.cmt: ハイフン、コロンを追加しました。

sen.j: - 毘沙門堂（延暦寺末寺）の子院・常不動院あり。
sen.e: The child shrine of Bitamendo (member of Enryaku-ji Temple), Dofudoin is here.
The child shrine of Bitamendo (member of Enryaku-ji Temple), Dofudoin is located here.
The branch temple of Bishamon-do Temple (member of Enryaku-ji Temple), Jofudo-in Temple is located here.
sen.cmt: branch temple としました。Bishamon スペルを修正しました。

sen.e: Gojo cho zengo hachicho
Gojo cho zengo hachicho
Gojo-cho zengohaccho:
sen.cmt: ハイフン、コロンを追加しました。

sen.j: - 高辻通・松原通・西洞院通・室町通に囲まれた地域。
sen.e: The area surrounded by Takatsuji dori, Matsubara dori, Nishitoin dori, Muromachi dori.
The area surrounded by Takatsuji dori, Matsubara dori, Nishitoin dori, Muromachi dori.
The area surrounded by Takatsuji-dori Street, Matsubara-dori Street, Nishinotoin-dori Street and Muromachi-dori Street.
sen.cmt: xx-dori Street と表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 当時の繁華街であり、延暦寺が地主。
sen.e: This was the busy town area of that time and the landowner was Enryaku-ji Temple.
This was the busy town area of that time and the landowner was the Enryaku-ji Temple.
This was the busy town area of that time and the landowner was the Enryaku-ji Temple.
Shichijyo cho
Shichijyo cho
Shichijo-cho
sen.cmt: ハイフンを追加しました。
